div.p: The following coaching positions are open:

All applications (or letters of intentâ if school employee) must be sent or given to Mrs. KosteleckyÂ atÂ tera.kostelecky@gmail.com. Or they can pick up an application from Jeana at the Stapleton school office. Along with this, please include a resume and and 2 letters of reference. These documents can be emailed orÂ dropped off at the Stapleton Schools office.
We will be hosting interviews between May 4th-6th.Â

a.aria-label: Read more about School Grounds Closed

h3.a: From the Superintendent's Desk: April Fool's Day

div.p: Today as I write this it is April Fools Day. By the time you read this April Fools will be gone, but COVID 19 wonât.Â Â It is an annual custom on APRIL 1 that it is consisting of practical jokes and hoaxes. The jokester often exposes their actions by shouting âApril Foolsâ at the recipient. But anyone who does April Fools Day this year will be shot into space. I wish someone, please, could tell me . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about From the Superintendent's Desk: April Fool's Day

div.p:
Â
Normally, I would share this information with students face to face but these are normal times. I am sending the script that I would have used. It is long but contains a lot of information. I found it to be the easiest way to explain the YouScience via social media. It contains resources that can be used. I encourage parents to view the parent URL and to visitÂ with your student about theirÂ results.Â
Last . . .

The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases has moved to 12 in the West Central Health District. Logan county and Stapleton Public Schools are part of this district. For this reason, Governor Pete Rickets has ordered Directed Health Measures. This means that schools must be closed through May 31 and extracurricular activities are canceled.Â
You may still come to the school today to pick up packets for lower elementary and personal . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Schools Closed Through May

div.p:
The contents of studentsâ lockers are being collected and bagged.Â Â They will be distributed just as Chromebooks were.Â Â
Â
Pull up to the northwest door.Â Â Instructors will be watching for you from the 2nd-grade room.Â Â You do not need to get out of the vehicle.Â Â They will quickly hand the material to you through the . . .
